Mike Pence does, gets one called by the elites, at mildest, "an ideologue." Elitists may call reflecting the values of the people, or, as the Declaration of Independence phrased it, the consent of the governed, ideological. There is another, and better grounded, way to frame what is going on here: Mike Pence is a man of the people. That is, for him, a matter of principle.

in ring MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While

A story published Saturday said Daniels would be the odds-on favorite for the GOP nomination in 2012 if pundits, conservative columnists and political thinkers represented the party's base. The diminutive Hoosier has nurtured a profile as a mature politician whose outlook extends beyond the next news cycle and whose demeanor exudes seriousness, the story said. It also noted that the candidate favored by party elites has almost always failed to win the nomination. As for Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives
